paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a novel frameshift mutation in the KCNH2 gene associated with Long QT Syndrome Type 2, detailing its functional effects and potential therapeutic interventions.

individual_records.phenotype_details: History of seizures misinterpreted as epilepsy, later identified as episodes of ventricular tachycardia.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband experienced an episode of ventricular tachycardia with loss of consciousness, requiring immediate defibrillation in the emergency department.

functional_data.summary: The S981fs mutation leads to reduced cell surface expression and lower current amplitude compared to wild-type hERG channels.

variants.segregation_data: Parental DNA analysis was not conducted, so segregation with disease in families could not be determined.
variants.population_frequency: Not reported in Taiwan Biobank or gnomAD.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation is novel and has not been previously reported.
key_quotes: This deletion induces a frameshift and premature termination of the protein (p.S981fs).
The identified mutation in our study is considered novel, as it has not been previously reported in the Taiwan Biobank and the Genome Aggregation Database (gnomAD).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant was extracted from the main text.
